text: - Hello, and welcome to Community Chats.

I'm Aley Hammer, and today
we're joined with Peter James,
the IT operations director at Amaysim.

Peter, every single year,
Amaysim seems to win
industry award after industry award.
And in 2021 alone,

I think you won Whistles
Out best mobile provider,

best prepaid provider,
and best plan for kids,

all without even having
a physical retail store.
This is so cool.

So what I wanna know is how the
heck are you able to provide
such great customer service
with just your people and tech alone?

- Our focus has been on
our customers, always,
like ever since we started,
even since before we were getting awards.
And we dedicate a lot to their digital

and self-service experience to
try and make things as simple
as possible to join and stay with us.

We leverage out the retail
stores to do this, but it's true,

we've never actually had a
dedicated retail footprint,
aside from a popup store here or there.

We think you should be able
to do everything you need
from our website and our mobile app.
But if you can't or you don't want to,

our customer service team
are really closely linked
to our business operations

and our operation and
technology teams as well,

which helps drive a really
a good digital experience.
And we're really looking

for people and technology
partners that really
can enhance that experience

and make it much easier for
our customers to do things.
Our company values simplicity,
empathy, reliability and agility,

and we look for that
whenever we're choosing

a technology partner
or a new staff member.

- Pretty incredible, and your
dedication to the digital

and self-service experience is
clearly working pretty well.

You've got such a loyal
customer base and you know

that's definitely
testament to all of that.

And Peter, we heard that
you guys recently had
your first ever company-wide hackathon,
I think in over six years,

and you decided to partner
exclusively with AWS.
So how was that event received, you know

during COVID and did anything
actually surprise you?

- Yeah, look, we've
tried to do this a couple

of times over the last
few years before that one

six years ago, which I was part
of and it was a lot of fun,
but something always came up.
We'd gone through a big period of growth.

We've bought companies, we've
solar parts of the company.

So this time, the AWS 10 really
lent some much-needed focus
and sponsorship, to be quite honest,
thank you for the Echo Dots,
that helped us ensure the event
was really a really big success.
It was also the last event
on the calendar year for a lot of people.

And as everyone knows,
the last couple of years
haven't been great for virtual events
or any kind of events in some ways.
So I was actually really worried that we

wouldn't get the take-up that
we actually ended up doing,
but we had a really great turnout.
I think we had over half the company

from the main office
join, which is amazing,
and some really good representation

from our customer service team
as well, because like I said,
they're a big part of our journey

and they know what our
customers are experiencing.
We had some amazing ideas.
We had a really tough time as judges.

We actually had to put up
a second set of prizes,

a third set of prizes, to
actually split second and third,
we couldn't choose.

And I was really happy
with the engagement we got

even towards the end of that
really tough end of 2021.

So it definitely won't take us
six years to do another one.

- Sounds like there's some
pretty strong competition,

and how great that so
many people got involved,

especially you said
towards the end of the year
everyone gets bit lazy and tired

and I guess those Echos
definitely helped, so--
- Definitely, yeah.

- So also you recently
created a data council
which is something that I was fascinated

about because it's, for
anyone who doesn't know,
and I didn't know, it's a diverse group
of senior technology leaders from amaysim.
This is really cool.

Can you explain to our
audience a little bit more

about what you're
actually trying to achieve
with this data council?
- Yeah, definitely.
So this is really in its infancy,

but it's something that
we've actually lent on AWS

as well to help us do
this because we realized
we didn't know everything,
which every now and then I have to admit.

But like many companies,
we're in an area where

we have far more data collection
points and requirements
than ever before.

Everyone talks about
drowning in their data lake
or something like that.

And we just can't make it the
data teams problem to sort
out, they just don't scale the same way.

So getting a bunch of
people across the business

not just from technology,
but from technology, data,

marketing and some other
areas to meet regularly
and understand the data we're collecting,

how it could be used
or how it could be used
and secured better.

'Cause it really is everyone's
responsibility to make sure
that our data is secure and being used

in the best possible way
for us and our customers.
Like I said, still into early stages
I'm really looking forward

to seeing how we can
change the way our business
and our customers get the value out

of this in 2022 and
hopefully beyond it as well.

- That's such a great idea,
and so true that all teams,

and I actually think not just
IT, should be looking at data

and contributing with ideas
and how to leverage it.
And Peter, amaysim is well-known
for showing customers big love.

So how will amaysim continue
showing customers big love
in the future?
What I wanna know is how do partners
like us at AWS help out with this as well?

- Look, I'll get in trouble
if I reveal too much

about roadmap but we love
surprising our customers
with extra data or inclusions,

and we don't think we
always need a reason.

Being customer-centric
has been a natural part

of the way we operate
ever since we started

over 10 years ago and
the last couple of years

and next few years won't
change that at all.

We've invested a lot of
time into our mobile app

and technology platforms
to help make it even easier

for everyone to join us
or manage their service

and initiatives like data
banking last year are

a great example of how our
teams continue to come up

with great new initiatives
with our technology partners to
show our customers big love.

Partners like AWS and
others, to be honest,
do allow our team to focus on the outcome

we're trying to achieve around
the technology behind it.

We can build on those building
blocks and provide really

great experience for our
new customers and then

innovate rapidly with a
relatively modest team,
given the size of our customer base.
We always think we can do more.

So please watch out some
exciting new announcement

that will refine this
technology experience

over the next 12 months
and beyond at amaysim.
- Well, Peter, I cannot wait
to continue watching your journey.

I love a surprise, so I'll
keep my eyes out and you know
it really shows your customer obsession
is so similar to ours and it is amazing
that you've got no physical stores

and that you've got such
a loyal customer base.
So I know I've said it before

but congrats on everything
you guys have achieved.
And we really love working with you.
- Thanks very much.

It's a really great
part of being able to be

a technology company
to work with companies
and partners like AWS,

and well done on not
using the amaysim pun,
we do it all the time. So well done.
(laughing)
- Took a bit of self control.
All right.
Thank you so much, Peter.
- Thanks very much.
See you later.

- Bye.
- Bye.
